cluster_relations.rel_desc: The adult stage of butterflies is characterized by mating behavior.
Adult butterflies exhibit mating behavior of finding a mate.
Female butterflies deposit their eggs on specific host plants.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Plant Structures as Lepidopteran Substrate and Background

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: LifeCycleContext: beginning of a new butterfly generation

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage displays or engages in a specific behavior.
args.justification: Both relations link a butterfly (or its adult life stage) to its mating behavior, expressing that the subject displays that behavior. Normalizing to a single predicate 'exhibits_behavior' captures this shared semantics.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a female organism deposits its eggs on a specified substrate or host.
args.justification: This relation connects female butterflies to host plants via the specific reproductive act of depositing eggs on those plants; a dedicated predicate 'lays_eggs_on' accurately and succinctly captures this oviposition behavior.

All three relations describe reproductive behaviors: mating behaviors in the first two and egg-laying (oviposition) behavior in the third. Grouping them under 'reproductive_behavior_relation' provides an appropriate mid-level semantic class.

Each relation describes actions or behaviors performed by agents (butterflies or their life stage), not composition, identity, or pure association. The broad category 'AGENCY' best captures these behavior- and action-oriented links.

executed_decisions.justification: This relation connects female butterflies to host plants via the specific reproductive act of depositing eggs on those plants; a dedicated predicate 'lays_eggs_on' accurately and succinctly captures this oviposition behavior.

All three relations describe reproductive behaviors: mating behaviors in the first two and egg-laying (oviposition) behavior in the third. Grouping them under 'reproductive_behavior_relation' provides an appropriate mid-level semantic class.
